Title: ChemCrow: Augmenting large-language models with chemistry tools
Authors: Andres M Bran, Sam Cox, Andrew D White, Philippe Schwaller
Summary: Over the last decades, excellent computational chemistry tools have been developed. Their full potential has not yet been reached as most are challenging to learn and exist in isolation. Recently, large-language models (LLMs) have shown strong performance in tasks across domains, but struggle with chemistry-related problems. Moreover, these models lack access to external knowledge sources, limiting their usefulness in scientific applications. In this study, we introduce ChemCrow, an LLM chemistry agent designed to accomplish tasks across organic synthesis, drug discovery, and materials design. By integrating 17 expert-designed tools, ChemCrow augments the LLM performance in chemistry, and new capabilities emerge. Our agent autonomously planned the syntheses of an insect repellent, three organocatalysts, as well as other relevant molecules. Our evaluation, including both LLM and expert assessments, demonstrates ChemCrow's effectiveness in automating a diverse set of chemical tasks. Surprisingly, we find that GPT-4 as an evaluator cannot distinguish between clearly wrong GPT-4 completions and Chemcrow's performance. There is a significant risk of misuse of tools like ChemCrow, and we discuss their potential harms. Employed responsibly, our work not only aids expert chemists and lowers barriers for non-experts, but also fosters scientific advancement by bridging the gap between experimental and computational chemistry. A subset of the code is publicly available at \url{https://github.com/ur-whitelab/chemcrow-public}.

main_contribution.headline: ChemCrow: Augmenting LLMs with Chemistry Tools for Enhanced Performance
main_contribution.description: The paper introduces ChemCrow, a Large Language Model (LLM) agent designed to enhance performance in chemistry-related tasks. ChemCrow integrates 17 expert-designed tools to augment the LLM's capabilities in organic synthesis, drug discovery, and materials design. The agent autonomously planned the syntheses of various molecules, demonstrating its effectiveness in automating a diverse set of chemical tasks. The paper also highlights the limitations of LLMs in distinguishing between incorrect completions and ChemCrow's performance, emphasizing the need for expert assessments in evaluating such models. The authors discuss potential misuse risks of tools like ChemCrow and propose mitigation strategies.

takeaways.headline: ChemCrow: A Powerful Tool for Automating Chemistry Tasks
takeaways.description: ChemCrow's integration of expert-designed tools into an LLM framework opens up new possibilities for automating complex tasks in chemistry. The agent's ability to plan syntheses of various molecules demonstrates its potential in practical applications such as drug discovery and materials design. However, the paper also highlights the limitations of LLMs in evaluating the performance of such models, emphasizing the need for expert assessments. The authors also discuss potential misuse risks and propose mitigation strategies, underlining the importance of responsible use of such powerful tools.
takeaways.example: ChemCrow can be used to automate complex tasks in chemistry. For instance, given a target molecule, ChemCrow can plan the synthesis using its integrated tools. The process would look something like this: 'Plan the synthesis of an insect repellent -> ChemCrow selects the appropriate tools -> ChemCrow uses the tools to plan the synthesis -> The synthesis plan is returned as the output.'

novelty_analysis: The introduction of ChemCrow represents a significant advancement in the application of LLMs to chemistry-related tasks. The integration of expert-designed tools into an LLM framework is a novel approach that significantly enhances the model's capabilities in this domain.
technical_analysis: The paper delves into the technical details of integrating expert-designed tools into an LLM framework, making it a technically advanced read. It discusses the implementation of various tools and their application in automating complex tasks in chemistry.
enjoyable_analysis: The paper presents an engaging narrative of the development and application of ChemCrow. The clear presentation of results, along with the discussion of potential risks and mitigation strategies, makes for an insightful and thought-provoking read.
